title: Advanced Microeconomics Foundations Course Based on Partial Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level economics fundamentals and mathematics basics (function and graph interpretation skills)
context.additional_context: A competency-enhancement course for pre-service or in-service teachers. Project-based assessment process operating in smartphone-centric limited technological environments. Learners are experienced working adults and advanced learners interested in solving real-life economic problems

learning_goals: Learners can analyze regional agricultural market price fluctuation scenarios using supply-demand models
Learners can write reports explaining personal consumption choice cases by applying marginal utility theory
Learners can design and execute negotiation simulation projects utilizing game theory concepts

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
